result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ignacio Rodriguez Quijas

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ignacio Rodriguez Quijas appeared by video.  Attorney Raymond E. Schrank appeared by video for Ignacio Rodriguez Quijas.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Enrique Barbosa sworn. Status conference held. Defense has received all discovery and is requesting a plea and sentencing. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Ignacio Rodriguez Quijas in court with attorney Raymond E. Schrank.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Kelly Salas. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ignacio Rodriguez Quijas in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes and Attorney Raymond Schrank.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn interpreter: Natalia Fajardo
Case in court for status of counsel. Attorney Schrank filed affidavit. Court finds defendant is voluntarily switching counsel. Court grants Attorney Fuentes's motion to withdraw. 
Attorney Schrank needs discovery and offer and requests an adjournment. Case remains calendared in Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Waiver of right to personal appearance
Affidavit of Ignacio Rodriguez Quijas, filed.
Correspondence to Judge Richards re next pretrial, filed. Forwarded to judge for review.

Defendant Ignacio Rodriguez Quijas in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes and Attorney Raymond Schrank.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Attorney Fuentes advises the Court he will be withdrawing as counsel on this case and advises the Court that the defendant needs a Spanish interpreter. 
Court orders matter adjourned to allow for defendant to appear with a Spanish interpreter. Case remains calendared in Br 30. 
  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Consent for Substitution of Attorneys, signed by the parties and filed.

Adjustment Number: 22A 044450,
Payable Number: 1005298,
Receipt Number: 22RP018676,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Ignacio Rodriguez Quijas in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Ignacio Rodriguez Quijas in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ignacio Rodriguez Quijas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case retabbed to Branch 30 due to nature of chargers.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

 This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1
Pre-trial Conference Scheduled June 1, 2022 at 08:30am
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
